title: Showery weather condition to enhance over several provinces
byline: The Meteorology Department says showery weather condition is expected to continue further over Northern, North-central, Eastern and Uva provinces for next few days.

title: Sri Lanka Police’s YouTube channel hacked
byline: The official YouTube channel of the Sri Lanka Police Department has been hacked, Police said.

title: Sri Lanka Printing Dept’s website hacked
byline: The official website of the Sri Lanka Department of Government Printing has been hacked and its data has been altered.

title: Constitutional Council to convene at Parliament today
byline: The Constitutional Council (CC) is scheduled to meet at 11.00 a.m. today (31) at the Parliament complex, chaired by Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne.

title: South Korea court issues arrest warrant for President Yoon
byline: A South Korean court on Tuesday approved an arrest warrant for President Yoon Suk Yeol, who has been impeached and suspended from power over his decision to impose martial law on Dec. 3, investigating authorities said.

title: Government to launch ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ program tomorrow
byline: The Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils, and Local Government has informed that an official ceremony should be held at all government institutions tomorrow (01), marking the beginning of the New Year.

title: Special announcement on reserved train tickets and refunds
byline: The Department of Railways has issued a special announcement regarding reserved train seat tickets and refunds.

title: Govt. urged to reduce VAT on salmon
byline: The Canned Fish Manufacturers’ Association of Sri Lanka (CFMASL) has requested the government to reduce the Value Added Tax (VAT) imposed on salmon.

title: New Sri Lanka Army Commander assumes duties
byline: Lieutenant General Lasantha Rodrigo has officially assumed duties as the 25th Commander of the Sri Lanka Army at the Army Headquarters, a short while ago.

title: Notice for students entering Grade 01 in 2025
byline: The school days for the students newly enrolled to the Grade 01 classes of all government and government-approved private schools for the academic year 2025 will commence on January 30, 2025.

title: US Treasury says Chinese hackers stole documents in ‘major incident’
byline: Chinese state-sponsored hackers breached the U.S. Treasury Department’s computer security guardrails this month and stole documents in what Treasury called a “major incident,” according to a letter to lawmakers,  that Treasury officials provided to Reuters on Monday.

title: SC delivers verdict in petitions against govt’s decision on 2024 Scholarship Exam
byline: The Supreme Court has declared that the fundamental human rights have been violated through the government’s decision to award free marks to all students for the three questions of the 2024 Grade 05 Scholarship Examination which are alleged to have been leaked.

title: Special traffic and parking plan in Colombo on New Year’s eve
byline: Sri Lanka Police has announced a special traffic plan to minimize congestion in Colombo city on New Year’s Eve, December 31, 2024.

title: New Sri Lanka Navy Commander assumes duties
byline: Vice Admiral Kanchana Banagoda has assumed duties as the new Commander of the Sri Lanka Navy at Navy Headquarters today (31).

title: Appropriation Bill for 2025 receives Cabinet approval
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to table the Appropriation Bill (Budget) for the Financial Year 2025 to the Parliament.

title: SME paddy businesses to get pledge loans at concessional rates every cultivation season
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has greenlighted the proposal to implement the Pledge Loan Scheme provided to small and medium scale paddy mill owners for purchasing paddy as an annual programme.

title: Govt. to review recruitment process in public institutions
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka will appoint an Officers’ Committee chaired by the Secretary to the Prime Minister to review the recruitment process and personnel management in the public service.

title: Govt. to make amendments to Sri Lanka Electricity Act 2024
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to reconsider the provisions of the Sri Lanka Electricity Act No. 36 of 2024, which came into force from June 27, and to make appropriate amendments.

title: Sri Lanka to establish ministerial level investigation units to ensure accountability
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved to establish investigation units in every ministry to ensure accountability of public institutions.

title: World’s largest pumped storage hydropower plant in full operation in China
byline: The Fengning pumped storage hydropower plant, the largest of its kind globally, has commenced full operation in the city of Chengde, north China’s Hebei Province.

title: Sri Lanka Customs clears 79,000 MT of imported rice
byline: Sri Lanka Customs has reported that as of 12 noon today (31), a total of 79,000 metric tonnes of imported rice have been cleared through customs.

title: Exams chief responds to SC verdict on 2024 Grade 05 Scholarship Exam issue
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations, Amith Jayasundara says that a final decision regarding the 2024 Grade 05 Scholarship Examination issue will be made immediately following a study into the Supreme Court verdict which was issued today (31) pertaining to the matter.

title: Colombo inflation increases in December 2024
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on Year-on-Year basis, has increased to -1.7% in December 2024, compared to -2.1% in November 2024, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: 2024 A/L results expected by April
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations, Amith Jayasundara announced that the results of the G.C.E. Advanced Level examination are expected to be released by April next year.

title: Kiribati becomes first country to enter New Year 2025
byline: As most of the world awaits 2025, the tiny island nation of Kiribati has already taken the lead, becoming the first to welcome the New Year. Kiritimati Island, also known as Christmas Island, located in the central Pacific Ocean, marks the dawn of January 1, 2025, as clocks struck midnight there earlier today.

title: Highest number of Sri Lankans left for foreign employment in 2024
byline: The year 2024 has set a historic record for the highest number of Sri Lankans migrating for work, with 312,836 individuals leaving the country for employment opportunities overseas.

title: Two remanded for ‘criminally intimidating’ two NPP MPs
byline: Two persons have been arrested for criminally intimidating two MPs of the National People’s Power (NPP) at a garment factory premises in Bingiriya yesterday (30).

title: Debate on 2025 Appropriation Bill begins on Feb. 18
byline: It has been decided at the meeting of the Committee on Parliamentary Business held in Parliament today (31) under the patronage of the Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne that the debate on the Appropriation Bill for the year 2025 (Budget Debate) will be held from February 18 to March 21, 2025.

title: Colombo Chief Magistrate Thilina Gamage transferred
byline: The Judicial Services Commission has transferred Colombo Chief Magistrate Thilina Gamage to Moratuwa District and Magistrate’s Court.

title: Kerosene price reduced; other fuels unchanged
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has announced a revision of Kerosene price effective from midnight today (31).

title: Gen. Shavendra Silva speaks out on ‘Aragalaya’ controversy after retiring
byline: The former Army Commander and Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), General Shavendra Silva, has officially retired from the service today (31), concluding a remarkable 41-year career dedicated to safeguarding Sri Lanka’s security and sovereignty.
